hints_html:
The definition of the variance is

\[\begin{aligned} \mathrm{Var}(X) = \int_a^b (x-\overline{X})^2 f(x)\, dx\end{aligned}\]

The calculation becomes a little easier when you use the identity

\[\begin{aligned} \mathrm{Var}(X) = \mathbb{E}(X^2) - (\mathbb{E}(X))^2.\end{aligned}\]
hints_raw:
The definition of the variance is

:<math>\mathrm{Var}(X) = \int_a^b (x-\overline{X})^2 f(x)\, dx</math>
The calculation becomes a little easier when you use the identity

:<math>\mathrm{Var}(X) = \mathbb{E}(X^2) - (\mathbb{E}(X))^2.</math>
question: 1 (n)
sols_html:
From the definition of the variance we can directly compute its value.

\[\begin{aligned} \mathrm{Var}(X) &= \int_a^b (x-\overline{X})^2 f(x)\, dx = \int_1^4 \left(x-\frac73\right)^2 \frac1{2\sqrt{x}}\,dx \\ &= \int_1^4 \left(\frac{x^2}{2\sqrt{x}} - \frac73 \frac{x}{\sqrt{x}} + \frac{49}9 \frac1{2\sqrt{x}}\right)\,dx \\ &= \int_1^4 \left(\frac12 x^{3/2} - \frac73 x^{1/2} + \frac{49}{18}x^{-1/2}\right)\,dx \\ &= \left.\left(\frac12 \frac25 x^{5/2} - \frac73 \frac23 x^{3/2} + \frac{49}{18} 2x^{1/2}\right)\right|_1^4 \\ &= \frac15\,32 - \frac{14}9\,8 + \frac{49}9\,2 - \left(\frac15 - \frac{14}9 + \frac{49}9\right) \\ &= \frac{34}{45}.\end{aligned}\]

Alternatively, we can also use the identity

\[\begin{aligned} \mathrm{Var}(X) = \mathbb{E}(X^2) - (\mathbb{E}(X))^2.\end{aligned}\]

We’re already given \(\mathbb{E}(X) = 7/3\) so we just need \(\mathbb{E}(X^2) = \int_1^4 x^2 f(x) dx\).

We compute this integral, finding \(\mathbb{E}(X^2) = \int_1^4 x^2 \frac{1}{2 \sqrt{x}} dx = \int_1^4 \frac{1}{2} x^{3/2} dx = \frac{1}{5} x^{5/2}|_1^4 = \frac{1}{5}(32-1) = 31/5.\)

Thus \(\mathrm{Var}(X) = \frac{31}{5} - (\frac{7}{3})^2 = 34/45\).
sols_latex:
From the definition of the variance we can directly compute its value.

\begin{align*}
\mathrm{Var}(X) &= \int_a^b (x-\overline{X})^2 f(x)\, dx = \int_1^4 \left(x-\frac73\right)^2 \frac1{2\sqrt{x}}\,dx \\
&= \int_1^4 \left(\frac{x^2}{2\sqrt{x}} - \frac73 \frac{x}{\sqrt{x}} + \frac{49}9 \frac1{2\sqrt{x}}\right)\,dx \\
&= \int_1^4 \left(\frac12 x^{3/2} - \frac73 x^{1/2} + \frac{49}{18}x^{-1/2}\right)\,dx \\
&= \left.\left(\frac12 \frac25 x^{5/2} - \frac73 \frac23 x^{3/2} + \frac{49}{18} 2x^{1/2}\right)\right|_1^4 \\
&= \frac15\,32 - \frac{14}9\,8 + \frac{49}9\,2 - \left(\frac15 - \frac{14}9 + \frac{49}9\right) \\
&= \frac{34}{45}.
\end{align*}

Alternatively, we can also use the identity

\begin{align*}
\mathrm{Var}(X) = \mathbb{E}(X^2) - (\mathbb{E}(X))^2.
\end{align*}

We're already given $\mathbb{E}(X) = 7/3$ so we just need
$\mathbb{E}(X^2) = \int_1^4 x^2 f(x) dx$.

We compute this integral, finding
$\mathbb{E}(X^2) = \int_1^4 x^2 \frac{1}{2 \sqrt{x}} dx = \int_1^4 \frac{1}{2} x^{3/2} dx = \frac{1}{5} x^{5/2}|_1^4 = \frac{1}{5}(32-1) = 31/5.$

Thus $\mathrm{Var}(X) = \frac{31}{5} - (\frac{7}{3})^2 = 34/45$.
sols_raw:
From the definition of the variance we can directly compute its value.

:<math>\begin{align}
\mathrm{Var}(X) &= \int_a^b (x-\overline{X})^2 f(x)\, dx = \int_1^4 \left(x-\frac73\right)^2 \frac1{2\sqrt{x}}\,dx \\
&= \int_1^4 \left(\frac{x^2}{2\sqrt{x}} - \frac73 \frac{x}{\sqrt{x}} + \frac{49}9 \frac1{2\sqrt{x}}\right)\,dx \\
&= \int_1^4 \left(\frac12 x^{3/2} - \frac73 x^{1/2} + \frac{49}{18}x^{-1/2}\right)\,dx \\
&= \left.\left(\frac12 \frac25 x^{5/2} - \frac73 \frac23 x^{3/2} + \frac{49}{18} 2x^{1/2}\right)\right|_1^4 \\
&= \frac15\,32 - \frac{14}9\,8 + \frac{49}9\,2 - \left(\frac15 - \frac{14}9 + \frac{49}9\right) \\
&= \frac{34}{45}.
\end{align}
</math>
Alternatively, we can also use the identity

:<math>\mathrm{Var}(X) = \mathbb{E}(X^2) - (\mathbb{E}(X))^2.</math>

We're already given <math>\mathbb{E}(X) = 7/3</math> so we just need <math>\mathbb{E}(X^2) = \int_1^4 x^2 f(x) dx</math>.

We compute this integral, finding <math>\mathbb{E}(X^2) = \int_1^4 x^2 \frac{1}{2 \sqrt{x}} dx = \int_1^4 \frac{1}{2} x^{3/2} dx = \frac{1}{5} x^{5/2}|_1^4 = \frac{1}{5}(32-1) = 31/5.</math>

Thus <math>\mathrm{Var}(X) = \frac{31}{5} - (\frac{7}{3})^2 = 34/45</math>.
statement_html:
Find the variance of the random variable X whose density function is

\[\begin{aligned} f(x) = \frac1{2\sqrt{x}} \quad 1 \leq x \leq 4.\end{aligned}\]

(You may need the fact that the expected value of the random variable X above is 7/3.)
statement_raw:
Find the variance of the random variable ''X'' whose density function is

:<math> f(x) = \frac1{2\sqrt{x}} \quad 1 \leq x \leq 4</math>.

''(You may need the fact that the expected value of the random variable X above is 7/3.)''
